titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 1836) to provide for reconciliation pursuant to section 104 of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2002.

action.text: CONSIDERATION OF MEASURE - Mr. Reynolds called up H. Res. 153 and the Speaker pro tempore put the question on consideration of the measure. By voice vote, the Speaker pro tempore announced that the ayes had prevailed.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 153.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-85, by Mr. Reynolds.
Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 1836.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 36.

action.text: The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213 - 177 (Roll No. 148).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/26/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 1836 (economic growth and tax relief reconciliation).
